record.dc:title: 39MG31(B) Hiwassee Island Site 63MG31, Meigs County, Tennessee. 63MG31 - Village. Features 2, 3, and 4, Superimposed fire basins, one at lower left with circularly arranged stones just above it, and two basins at the upper right. Sq. 15L1. Direction west.
record.wpa:narrative: [Feature 2] Small oval fire basin. Hard baked but no rim - lies 0.2 below surface. Seems to be associated with baked floor and overlaid with considerable wattle. No post hole pattern could be found. Lay above Feature 3. [Feature 3] Large oval firebasin. Lay just below surface and below Feature 2. Seems to be associated with baked floor. Overlaid with considerable wattle. No post hole pattern could be associated. [Feature 4] Small fire basin lined with hard baked puddled clay. Partly baked clay floor seems to surround fire basin. Floor very soft and not baked red but seems to be composed of clay.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustrations on file at the institution.
